name: Texel
notes: Primary VOC departure anchorage off North Holland.

name: Amsterdam
notes: VOC Amsterdam chamber, largest VOC office.

name: Middelburg
notes: VOC Zeeland chamber headquarters.

name: Vlissingen
notes: Port at the mouth of the Scheldt, Zeeland.

name: Rotterdam
notes: VOC Rotterdam chamber.

name: Delft
notes: VOC Delft chamber, ships sailed from Delfshaven.

name: Hoorn
notes: VOC Hoorn chamber.

name: Enkhuizen
notes: VOC Enkhuizen chamber.

name: Goeree
notes: Anchorage off Goeree island, common departure point.

name: Rammekens
notes: Fortress anchorage near Vlissingen, Zeeland departure point.

name: Wielingen
notes: Channel at the mouth of the Scheldt.

name: The Downs
notes: Anchorage off Deal, England. Common waiting point.

name: English Channel
notes: Waterway between England and France.

name: Dover
notes: English port at the narrowest point of the Channel.

name: Plymouth
notes: English port, sometimes used as refuge.

name: Falmouth
notes: English port, used for reprovisioning.

name: Hastings
notes: English port on the south coast.

name: Dungeness
notes: Headland on the English south coast.

name: Ushant
notes: Island off Brittany, major navigation waypoint.

name: Bay of Biscay
notes: Notoriously rough waters between France and Spain.

name: Cadiz
notes: Spanish port, sometimes visited for supplies.

name: Madeira
notes: Portuguese island, waypoint on southward route.

name: Canary Islands
notes: Spanish islands, common waypoint.

name: Tenerife
notes: Largest Canary Island.

name: Cape Verde
notes: Portuguese islands, major provisioning stop.

name: Santiago
notes: Largest Cape Verde island, watering point.

name: Ascension Island
notes: Remote Atlantic island.

name: St Helena
notes: British island, used as provisioning stop on return voyages.

name: Tristan da Cunha
notes: Remote South Atlantic island.

name: Sierra Leone
notes: West African coast, watering point.

name: Cape Palmas
notes: Headland on the Ivory Coast / Liberia border.

name: Elmina
notes: Dutch West India Company fort on the Gold Coast.

name: Annobon
notes: Island in the Gulf of Guinea.

name: Luanda
notes: Portuguese port in Angola.

name: Cape of Good Hope
notes: Southern tip of Africa, critical waypoint.

name: Table Bay
notes: Main VOC anchorage at the Cape, site of Cape Town.

name: Cape Town
notes: VOC refreshment station established 1652.

name: False Bay
notes: Bay east of Cape of Good Hope, winter anchorage.

name: Simon's Bay
notes: Sheltered anchorage in False Bay.

name: Saldanha Bay
notes: Natural harbour north of Cape Town.

name: Robben Island
notes: Island in Table Bay, used by VOC.

name: Cape Agulhas
notes: Southernmost point of Africa.

name: Struisbaai
notes: Bay near Cape Agulhas. Several VOC wrecks here.

name: Algoa Bay
notes: Bay on the south-east coast of South Africa.

name: Mossel Bay
notes: Bay on the southern coast of South Africa.

name: Mozambique
notes: Portuguese fortress and hospital on island off East African coast. Major refreshment port on the Carreira da India.

name: Mozambique Channel
notes: Channel between Madagascar and East Africa.

name: Delagoa Bay
notes: Natural harbour, present-day Maputo.

name: Sofala
notes: Portuguese trading post on the Mozambique coast.

name: Zanzibar
notes: Island off the East African coast.

name: Madagascar
notes: Large island east of Africa.

name: Fort Dauphin
notes: French settlement on southern Madagascar.

name: Comoro Islands
notes: Island group between Madagascar and East Africa.

name: Natal
notes: Coast of present-day KwaZulu-Natal.

name: Mauritius
notes: Island in the Indian Ocean, Dutch colony 1638-1710.

name: Réunion
notes: French island east of Madagascar.

name: Rodrigues
notes: Island east of Mauritius.

name: Diego Garcia
notes: Atoll in the Chagos Archipelago.

name: Maldives
notes: Archipelago in the central Indian Ocean.

name: Seychelles
notes: Archipelago in the western Indian Ocean.

name: Goa
notes: Portuguese colonial capital on the west coast of India.

name: Surat
notes: Major Mughal port, VOC factory.

name: Cochin
notes: VOC headquarters in Malabar from 1663.

name: Calicut
notes: Major spice trading port.

name: Cannanore
notes: VOC factory on the Malabar coast.

name: Malabar Coast
notes: Western coast of India, pepper and spice region.

name: Bombay
notes: English East India Company base, west coast of India.

name: Diu
notes: Portuguese fortress island off Gujarat.

name: Pulicat
notes: VOC factory, early headquarters on Coromandel coast.

name: Nagapattinam
notes: VOC headquarters on Coromandel coast from 1660.

name: Masulipatnam
notes: VOC factory, major textile trading port.

name: Madras
notes: English East India Company base.

name: Coromandel Coast
notes: Eastern coast of India, major textile region.

name: Pondicherry
notes: French trading post on the Coromandel coast.

name: Colombo
notes: VOC headquarters in Ceylon.

name: Galle
notes: Major VOC port, southern Ceylon.

name: Trincomalee
notes: Natural harbour, eastern Ceylon.

name: Jaffna
notes: VOC territory, northern Ceylon.

name: Point de Galle
notes: Southern tip of Ceylon, major VOC port.

name: Hooghly
notes: VOC factory on the Hooghly River.

name: Chinsura
notes: VOC factory in Bengal.

name: Bengal
notes: Region in eastern India, Bay of Bengal.

name: Calcutta
notes: English East India Company base in Bengal.

name: Andaman Islands
notes: Island group in the Bay of Bengal.

name: Nicobar Islands
notes: Island group south of the Andamans.

name: Malacca
notes: VOC fortress, key port on the Straits of Malacca.

name: Straits of Malacca
notes: Key shipping lane between Sumatra and Malay Peninsula.

name: Penang
notes: Island at the northern end of the Straits.

name: Aceh
notes: Sultanate on the northern tip of Sumatra.

name: Perak
notes: Malay tin-producing state.

name: Kedah
notes: Malay state on the Straits.

name: Batavia
notes: VOC Asian headquarters from 1619.

name: Sunda Strait
notes: Strait between Java and Sumatra.

name: Bantam
notes: Pepper port in western Java, early VOC presence.

name: Semarang
notes: Port on the north coast of Java.

name: Surabaya
notes: Major port in eastern Java.

name: Bali
notes: Island east of Java.

name: Lombok
notes: Island east of Bali.

name: Bali Strait
notes: Narrow strait between Java and Bali.

name: Ambon
notes: VOC spice trade centre in the Moluccas.

name: Banda Islands
notes: Nutmeg and mace monopoly centre.

name: Ternate
notes: Clove-producing island in the Moluccas.

name: Tidore
notes: Clove-producing island in the Moluccas.

name: Makassar
notes: Major port in Sulawesi.

name: Palembang
notes: Pepper port on the Musi River, Sumatra.

name: Padang
notes: VOC factory on the west coast of Sumatra.

name: Timor
notes: Island in eastern Indonesia, sandalwood trade.

name: Kupang
notes: VOC post on western Timor.

name: Borneo
notes: Large island, VOC traded pepper and diamonds.

name: Banjarmasin
notes: Pepper port on the south coast of Borneo.

name: Onrust
notes: VOC shipyard island near Batavia.

name: Bawean
notes: Island in the Java Sea, north of Java.

name: Java Sea
notes: Shallow sea between Java and Borneo.

name: Flores
notes: Island in the Lesser Sundas.

name: Sumba
notes: Island in the Lesser Sundas.

name: Sumbawa
notes: Island in the Lesser Sundas.

name: Sulawesi
notes: Large island in central Indonesia.

name: Buton
notes: Island off southeast Sulawesi.

name: Canton
notes: Major Chinese trading port.

name: Macao
notes: Portuguese colony, major trading port.

name: Taiwan
notes: VOC colony 1624-1662 (Fort Zeelandia).

name: Tayouan
notes: VOC fort and trading post on Taiwan.

name: Manila
notes: Spanish colonial capital of the Philippines.

name: Tonkin
notes: VOC trading post in northern Vietnam.

name: Hoi An
notes: Vietnamese trading port.

name: Siam
notes: VOC factory in the Siamese capital.

name: Cambodia
notes: VOC trading connections.

name: Paracel Islands
notes: Reef-studded island group, navigation hazard.

name: South China Sea
notes: Major shipping route between SE Asia and China/Japan.

name: Deshima
notes: Artificial island in Nagasaki harbour, sole VOC trading post in Japan.

name: Nagasaki
notes: Japanese port, location of VOC Deshima factory.

name: Hirado
notes: VOC factory 1609-1641, before move to Deshima.

name: Curaçao
notes: WIC colony, occasional VOC vessel destination.

name: Sint Eustatius
notes: WIC trading island, sometimes visited by VOC ships.

name: Abrolhos Islands
notes: Reef system off Western Australia. Site of Batavia wreck (1629).

name: Dirk Hartog Island
notes: Island off Western Australia, first recorded European landing 1616.

name: Rottnest Island
notes: Island off Western Australia.

name: Western Australia
notes: Coast of Western Australia, several VOC wrecks.

name: Mocha
notes: Coffee trading port in Yemen.

name: Aden
notes: Port at the entrance to the Red Sea.

name: Persia
notes: VOC factory in Persia (modern Bandar Abbas).

name: Basra
notes: Port at the head of the Persian Gulf.

name: Tanjore
notes: Kingdom on the Coromandel coast.

name: Tuticorin
notes: Pearl fishing port, southern Coromandel.

name: Vengurla
notes: VOC factory on the Malabar coast.

name: Wingurla
notes: VOC factory on the Malabar coast.

name: Sadras
notes: VOC factory on the Coromandel coast.

name: London
notes: EIC headquarters. Ships fitted at Deptford and Blackwall yards on the Thames.

name: The Downs
notes: Sheltered anchorage off Deal, Kent. Assembly point for EIC convoys awaiting fair wind.

name: Lisbon
notes: Portuguese capital. Departure point for the Carreira da India. Belem Tower.

name: Gothenburg
notes: SOIC (Swedish East India Company) headquarters on the Swedish west coast.

name: Acapulco
notes: Pacific port of New Spain. Western terminus of the Manila Galleon trade.

name: Guam
notes: Spanish Marianas. Critical provisioning stop on the Manila Galleon westbound route.

name: Cape Mendocino
notes: California landfall for eastbound Manila Galleon. First sight of land after months at sea.

name: Azores
notes: Portuguese islands in the mid-Atlantic. Watering stop on Carreira da India return voyage.

name: San Bernardino Strait
notes: Strait between Luzon and Samar. Entry/exit point for Manila Galleon to Philippine waters.

name: Masulipatnam
notes: Major textile trading port on the Coromandel coast. Both EIC and VOC maintained factories here.
